name: Braised Beef Rendang
description: A rich and aromatic Indonesian slow-cooked beef stew. This Braised Beef Rendang features tender beef chuck simmered in a complex spice paste and coconut milk until the liquid evaporates and the meat is caramelized and bursting with flavor from lemongrass, galangal, chilis, and kaffir lime.
keywords: Beef Rendang, Indonesian cuisine, slow-cooked beef, braised beef, coconut milk recipe, spicy beef dish, main course, dinner recipe, authentic Rendang, Asian food, beef chuck recipe, lemongrass, galangal, kaffir lime, tamarind, spice paste, traditional Indonesian food, comfort food, rich beef stew, caramelized beef

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the beef into bite sized pieces. If using shortrib, you can do that after braising. Heat the oil in a large pot and sear the beef on all sides, ensure good even browning.
recipeInstructions.name: Sear Beef

recipeInstructions.text: Add the rest of the braising ingredients to the pot and add water until just above the beef. Bring to a simmer, cover and leave for about 3h or until tender.
recipeInstructions.name: Braise Beef

recipeInstructions.text: While the beef braises, mince all of the spice paste ingredients in a blender or mortar & pestle. Add a bit of water if needed.
recipeInstructions.name: Mince Spice Paste

recipeInstructions.text: About an hour before the beef in tender, in a large pan, simmer the coconut milk down until nice and thick and almost sticking.
recipeInstructions.name: Simmer Coconut Milk

recipeInstructions.text: Add the spice paste to the large pan and start to simmer down.
recipeInstructions.name: Simmer Spice Paste

recipeInstructions.text: Stir spice paste continuously and when the spice paste starts to stick and brown, add a spoonful of braising liquid and scrape the bottom of the pan. Repeat until the mix is thick, a rich dark brown and there is no braising liquid left. Can take about an hour.
recipeInstructions.name: Simmer Spice Paste Further

recipeInstructions.text: Remove bits (garlic, cinnamon etc) from beef. Add beef and beef stock powder to the spice paste, mix through. Add salt to taste. Serve and enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Add Beef, Season and Serve

notes: Requires constant attention for the spice paste simmering to ensure it doesn't burn but it creates an amazing caramelised flavour.
